title: Development Process
body_html:
Notes App Development - A Potential Blog Post

This documents the development of a simple notes application using OpenHands, suitable for a potential blog post.

Project Goal: Create a basic notes app with functionality to add and view notes, using OpenHands for development.

Workflow:

  1. Initial Setup:

    • Started a new OpenHands conversation.
    • Defined initial requirements: add_note and view_notes functions.

  2. Iterative Development:

    • Opson implemented basic functions using Python and Flask.
    • Initial version used in-memory storage.
    • Reviewed and provided feedback.

  3. Data Persistence:

    • Discussed data persistence options: in-memory, file-based, SQLite.
    • Chose SQLite for its simplicity and robustness.
    • Opson implemented SQLite integration using SQLAlchemy.

  4. Web Interface:

    • Requested a web interface for easier interaction.
    • Opson developed a basic HTML/JavaScript frontend.

  5. Challenges and Solutions:

    • Issue: Notes were not initially visible after being added.
    • Solution: Opson investigated and fixed issues with database initialization and data flow.
    • Restarted application.
    • Added test notes.
    • Ensured the connection between frontend and backend

  6. Final Version:

    • Verified functionality: adding, viewing, persistence, tags, timestamps.
    • Clean and responsive web interface.

Key Technologies:

  • OpenHands
  • Python (Flask)
  • SQLite
  • SQLAlchemy
  • HTML/JavaScript

Potential Blog Post Outline:

  • Introduction: Building a notes app with OpenHands.
  • Step-by-step development process.
  • Code snippets (Python, SQL, HTML, JavaScript).
  • Screenshots of the interface.
  • Discussion of challenges and solutions.
  • Conclusion: Benefits of using OpenHands for rapid prototyping.
